section.title: Submodules - repositories inside other Git repositories
section.section:
What are submodules?
LARSPRIMARYINDEX"Submodules"LARSPRIMARYINDEX
LARSPRIMARYINDEX"git submodules"LARSPRIMARYINDEX
Git allows you to include other Git repositories into a Git repository. This is useful in case you want to include a certain library in another repository or in case you want to aggregate certain Git repositories.
Git calls these included Git repositories submodules . Git allows you to commit, pull and push to these repositories independently.

section.title: Adding a submodule to a Git repository
section.para: You add a submodule to a Git repository via the git submodule add command. The git submodule init command creates the local configuration file for the submodules if this configuration does not exist.
